p: You must have received the drum shortly after you wrote the last Thursday. We hoped you would have the drum to use Friday.

You plan as to costumes (with the colors of the four quarters indicidental) is all right, of course; but I do wish when you perform the whole ceremony later on, the girls could wear cheap dresses of the proper color.
I should think the Spring might well do for all four groups.
Do you remember the omaha Indian air I've often whistled? If so, I could put some one of Black Elk's holy
songs in shape to be sing to that air.
Hiddy could give you the meaning of that song you quote. I forget; but it's a love song, I'm quite sure.
When you produce the complete ceremony, shouldn't you have all of Black Elk's regalia?
Yes, I know of Col. Rice and his sonnets; but I know his brother's work better. Cole Young Rice and I used to correspond. We were quite friendly.
I never forget you at night in the garden.
